channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 'Melania' is Amazon's airbrushed and astronomically pricey portrait of the First Lady
item.description: Amazon paid $40 million to acquire the documentary, and is spending $35 million more to promote it.
item.content:encoded:
Amazon paid $40 million to acquire the documentary, and is spending $35 million more to promote it.

(Image credit: Muse Films)
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: Photos: Thousands once again protest ICE in Minneapolis and across the U.S.
item.description: Demonstrators in Minneapolis and other U.S. cities participated in protests as part of a "national shutdown" to end immigration enforcement operations.
item.content:encoded:
Demonstrators in Minneapolis and other U.S. cities participated in protests as part of a "national shutdown" to end immigration enforcement operations.

(Image credit: Jaida Grey Eagle for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Danielle A. Scruggs

item.title: Judge rules Luigi Mangione should not face death penalty
item.description: A federal judge dropped two of the charges against Luigi Mangione — the man accused of fatally shooting UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson — making his case no longer eligible for the death penalty.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge dropped two of the charges against Luigi Mangione — the man accused of fatally shooting UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson — making his case no longer eligible for the death penalty.

(Image credit: Curtis Means)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Blue Origin pauses space tourism flights to focus on lunar lander
item.description: Blue Origin, owned by billionaire Jeff Bezos, says it's stopping human spaceflights for at least two years. The move will allow it to "shift resources" to the company's lunar landing capabilities.
item.content:encoded:
Blue Origin, owned by billionaire Jeff Bezos, says it's stopping human spaceflights for at least two years. The move will allow it to "shift resources" to the company's lunar landing capabilities.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Brendan Byrne

item.title: Tim Walz says Trump administration wants to 'twist reality' in Minnesota
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz about the Trump administration's immigration crackdown in his state.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Minnesota Gov. Tim Walz about the Trump administration's immigration crackdown in his state.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Lila Iké learned what "self-love" means with her Grammy-nominated album
item.description: Lila Iké's full-length debut album, Treasure Self Love, has been nominated for a Grammy. Iké spoke to All Things Considered about being one of the only women ever to receive a nomination for best reggae album.
item.content:encoded:
Lila Iké's full-length debut album, Treasure Self Love, has been nominated for a Grammy. Iké spoke to All Things Considered about being one of the only women ever to receive a nomination for best reggae album.

(Image credit: Destinee Condison)
item.dc:creator: Ailsa Chang

item.title: Texas A&M University cancels programs in women's and gender studies
item.description: The university said it had also modified hundreds of courses and cancelled six in efforts to eliminate teaching related to diversity, equity and inclusion.
item.content:encoded:
The university said it had also modified hundreds of courses and cancelled six in efforts to eliminate teaching related to diversity, equity and inclusion.

(Image credit: Jay Janner)
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: How American Katie Uhlaender was denied Olympic bid by Canadian coach's point scheme
item.description: Sports officials say a Canadian coach manipulated the point system used by athletes to qualify for the Olympics. His move cost American sled racer Katie Uhlaender her trip to the Milan Cortina Games.
item.content:encoded:
Sports officials say a Canadian coach manipulated the point system used by athletes to qualify for the Olympics. His move cost American sled racer Katie Uhlaender her trip to the Milan Cortina Games.

(Image credit: Odd Andersen)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: U.S. ultimatum to vaccine group: No more funds unless you stop using thimerosal
item.description: This mercury-containing compound, used as a vaccine preservative, is commonly used in lower-income countries — and deemed safe. The U.S. is now demanding that Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance stop using it.
item.content:encoded:
This mercury-containing compound, used as a vaccine preservative, is commonly used in lower-income countries — and deemed safe. The U.S. is now demanding that Gavi, the Vaccine Alliance stop using it.

(Image credit: Jürgen Bätz/Picture Alliance)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: Catherine O'Hara, who starred in 'Home Alone' and 'Schitt's Creek,' dies at 71
item.description: O'Hara enjoyed a six-decade career in TV and films playing sometimes over-the-top, but endearing characters. "I loved playing cocky untalented people," she told Fresh Air in 1992.
item.content:encoded:
O'Hara enjoyed a six-decade career in TV and films playing sometimes over-the-top, but endearing characters. "I loved playing cocky untalented people," she told Fresh Air in 1992.

(Image credit: Chris Pizzello)
item.dc:creator: Mandalit del Barco
